flame a data-mining virus had spread
into the computer systems of
high-ranking Iranian officials
potentially causing even more damage
than the notorious Stuxnet virus Stuxnet
was aimed at Iran's nuclear program it
was a small piece of malware that was
hidden inside switches that are used to
turn centrifuges which Iran uses to
enrich Iranian on and off this new virus
flame is the fourth virus that has hit
Iran's computer systems and it really
adds to an Iranian feeling of being
besieged they also look at other
incidents mysterious explosions and
missile bases mysterious explosions of
gas pipelines and they feel that their
enemies America and Israel are involved
in covert warfare against Iran's
economical infrastructure now of course
it has not been proven but it's
certainly how they feel now we mustn't
forget this comes at a time that Iran is
trying from its point of view to reach
out to the west they are engaging in
talks that are ongoing the next meeting
for talks between iran and world powers
is scheduled for 18 of june in moscow
and of course the Iranians feel that

they want to talk with us about a
nuclear pro
and on the other hand they are possibly

we feel that they don't really want to

guitarist and folk singer doc watson
died Tuesday at the age of 89 mr. Watson
elevated the guitars status in bluegrass
and country music and his flat picking
style influenced generations of folk and
rock guitarists
blind since infancy he began playing
guitar in North Carolina as a child in
the 1950s he adapted rapid-fire melodies
normally played on the banjo and fiddle
to the guitar it would become his
hallmark technique
his son Merle later joined him on stage
leading to a partnership that won
multiple Grammys they played together
until Merle died in a tractor accident
at 36 mr. Watson continued to perform
into his late 80s
